Elements.name: Count Philip
Elements.description: Count Philip is the Lord of the Manor. He likes his food to taste hot and likes well-cooked food: neither burned nor too rare.
Elements.pFeedback3: Strong and hot! Just the way I like it!
Elements.pFeedback5: The <ingredient> was neither burned nor too tender.
Elements.nTrigger1: Heat Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger2: Heat Process Above Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger3: Heat Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback3: The <ingredient> was so undercooked it was basically raw!
Elements.nTrigger4: Heat Process Above Green in Red

Elements.name: Lady Florine
Elements.description: Lady Florine is my mistress. Her well-educated palette notwithstanding, she has a strong preference for Cold-tasting Dishes. She also enjoys her food well-cut, but not TOO well-cut.
Elements.pFeedback4: You cut the <ingredient> quite finely, I must say.
Elements.nFeedback1: The <ingredient> was a bit chunky. Cut it for longer next time.
Elements.nTrigger3: Cutting Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback3: The <ingredient> was so poorly done, it qas essentially uncut.
Elements.nTrigger4: Cutting Process Above Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback4: You cut the <ingredient> far too small.

Elements.name: Anna
Elements.description: Anna is the excitable young lady of the house. She is uncommonly fond of Dry tastes and notices when her food is poorly ground.
Elements.pFeedback1: I like how dry it is!
Elements.nTrigger1: Grinding Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nFeedback1: The <ingredient> was gritty. It needed more pounding.
Elements.nTrigger2: Grinding Process Below Green in Red

Elements.name: Henri
Elements.description: The quiet Henri is the Count's heir. He is fond of Moist tastes and coincidentally, well-simmered food.
Elements.pFeedback1: Wonderful Moist Humors in this dish.
Elements.pFeedback4: The <ingredient> came out so tenderly. You must have simmered it well.
Elements.pFeedback5: The simmering of <ingredient> was well done.
Elements.nFeedback3: If I may say, the <ingredient> was only barely boiled.
Elements.nFeedback4: The <ingredient> became flavorless mush when you boiled it for so long.

Elements.name: Master Roger of Bologna
Elements.ladyDescription: The good physician Roger, to keep an eye on our health
Elements.description: Roger is a doctor from one of the universities in Italy. As may be expected, he craves balance in all flavors. He also likes finely-ground ingredients, when relevant.
Elements.pFeedback1: The Hot and Cold Humors of this dish are well balanced.
Elements.pFeedback2: The Moisture and Dry Humors of this Dish are well Balanced.
Elements.pTrigger3: If Moisture Score is between -1 AND 1 and Heat Score is Between -1 and 1
Elements.pFeedback3: The humors in this dish were perfectly balanced! Quite well done!
Elements.pFeedback4: I appreciated how finely ground the <ingredient> was.
Elements.pFeedback5: The <ingredient> was of an enjoyable texture.
Elements.nTrigger1: Grinding Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger2: Grinding Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback2: Such a ghastly grit the <ingredient> made.

Elements.name: Renaud d'Oc
Elements.ladyDescription: The Occitan minstrel Renaud. I'm told he likes Cold food, but his dislike for poorly-cooked meals is his most famous taste;
Elements.description: An annoying twangster. Likes Cold-tasting foods, but will complain about anything over- or underdone.
Elements.pFeedback1: Ah, such a cool dish this was.
Elements.pFeedback3: Oh, such a delightfully chill dish I shan't forget!
Elements.nTrigger1: Heat Process Above Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback1: The <ingredient> was charred as though struck by lightning!
Elements.nTrigger2: Heat Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback2: This didn't get cooked at all!
Elements.nTrigger3: Grinding Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback3: I felt as though I'd ingested the dust of Egypt.
Elements.nTrigger4: Cutting Process Above Green In Red
Elements.nFeedback4: The poor <ingredient> looked as if it had offended some infuriated soldier, it had been cut so savagely.
Elements.nTrigger5: Cutting Process Above Below Green In Red
Elements.nFeedback5: Such poorly cut <ingredient> could choke a cow.

Elements.name: Brother Raymond
Elements.ladyDescription: The monk Raymond. He enjoys Cold dishes and well-baked and -roasted ingredients
Elements.description: Raymond is apparently an important abbot from somewhere nearby. He responds to Cold food, as well as anything that has been in the oven.
Elements.pFeedback3: May God smile upon you for your delightfully cold cookery.
Elements.pFeedback5: You heated the <ingredient> quite carefully, I see.
Elements.nFeedback2: I detected a faint smoky flavor in the <ingredient>...
Elements.nFeedback3: Do not be afraid of the fire of the oven. It is there to help you make good food.
Elements.nFeedback4: The <ingredient> must have sinned greatly to invite the fires of hell into your oven.

Elements.name: Lady Anna de Chalons
Elements.ladyDescription: My Lord's sister Anna. She knows her way around a Range and likes Hot-tasting foods.
Elements.description: The young Anna's aunt and namesake. Appreciates Hot food and ingredients well-cooked on the range.
Elements.pFeedback3: This dish may have burned my soul and sent me to heaven it was so good.
Elements.pFeedback4: Your treatment of the <ingredient> shows how good you can be with a stove.
Elements.pFeedback5: I noticed the care with which you heated the <ingredient>.
Elements.nTrigger1: Range Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger2: Range Process Above Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger3: Range Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback3: Did you even spend any time at the range with the <ingredient>?
Elements.nTrigger4: Range Process Above Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback4: Supervise the <ingredient> at the range more next time!

Elements.name: Sir Conrad the Swabian
Elements.ladyDescription: My Lord's old war commander, Conrad. An odd one. He enjoys Moist dishes, but also, well-ground ingredients.
Elements.description: Conrad is an old knight with a lot of war experience. For some reason, he likes Cold-tasting foods and well-ground ingredients.
Elements.pFeedback1: The moisture of this dish was good.
Elements.nTrigger1: Grinding Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger2: Grinding Process Below Green in Red

Elements.name: Master Simon de Paris
Elements.ladyDescription: A food critic from Paris named Simon. Expect him to carefully look for balance precisely-cooked food.
Elements.description: A French self-proclaimed food critic, whatever that means. Apparently all about balance, both in flavors and in execution. Don't overdo it, don't underdo it.
Elements.pFeedback1: The Hot and Cold Humors were quite harmonious.
Elements.pFeedback2: The Moist and Dry Humors of this were quite harmonious.
Elements.pTrigger3: If Moisture Score is between -1 AND 1 and Heat Score is Between -1 and 1
Elements.pFeedback3: Such perfect balance! I shall remember this.
Elements.nTrigger1: Heat Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nFeedback1: Needed more time in the heat on the <ingredient>.
Elements.nTrigger2: Heat Process Above Green in Yellow
Elements.nTrigger3: Heat Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nTrigger4: Heat Process Above Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback4: Did you mean to throw the <ingredient> out? I am not a garbage heap!

Elements.name: Master Antonio of Venice
Elements.ladyDescription: The merchant Antonio, who thankfully made his caravan stay outside the walls. Responds to hot and well-cooked food.
Elements.description: Antonio is a merchant who likes his food Hot and well-cut.
Elements.pFeedback1: This had a charming warmth to it.
Elements.pFeedback3: This kind of dish is what I bring spices across the sea for.
Elements.pFeedback4: Such precise knifework as you showed with the <ingredient> is worthy of some recognition.
Elements.pFeedback5: I see from the <ingredient> that you know your way around your knives...
Elements.nFeedback1: No, your cutting of the <ingredient> is not worth remembering.
Elements.nFeedback2: No, your cutting of the <ingredient> is not worth remembering.
Elements.nTrigger3: Cutting Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback3: The <ingredient> was cut so poorly, why, you'd do better trying to sell water to a drowning man.
Elements.nTrigger4: Cutting Process Above Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback4: Be careful with that knife of yours.

Elements.name: Count Godfrey
Elements.ladyDescription: Our friend Godfrey, on his way to speak as a legate in foreign lands. He likes Dry and well-ground food.
Elements.description: Godfrey is a well-traveled diplomat with a penchant for good food. He tends to talk about Dry and well-ground food.
Elements.pFeedback3: Rarely have I had the pleasure of a dish so dry tasting. I shall reember this.
Elements.pFeedback4: <ingredients> ground quite so fine are hard to come by.
Elements.nTrigger1: Grinding Process Below Green in Yellow
Elements.nFeedback1: The <ingredient> was passing rough, I'm sure you'd agree,
Elements.nTrigger2: Grinding Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback2: It is remarkable how poorly ground the <ingredient> was.

Elements.name: King of France
Elements.ladyDescription: His Majesty, the King. Fond of balanced flavors and well-roasted foods.
Elements.description: The king enjoys balance in his meals as well as his politics. He is also fond of roasted foods.
Elements.pFeedback1: The Hot and Cold Humors show a refined skill.
Elements.pFeedback2: The Moist and Dry Humors of this Dish dance upon the tounge evenly.
Elements.pTrigger3: If Moist is between -1 AND 1 and Heat is Between -1 and 1
Elements.pFeedback3: I have no memory of such a well balanced dish.  Incredible.
Elements.pFeedback4: The roasted <ingredient> was good enough to be called legendary.
Elements.pFeedback5: The <ingredient> was roasted relatively well for my tastes.
Elements.nFeedback1: The <ingredient> needed more time roasting in the fire.
Elements.nFeedback2: The char on the <ingredient> was a bit much.
Elements.nTrigger3: Roast Process Below Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback3: The <ingredient> was practically raw. Not much of a roast!
Elements.nTrigger4: Roast Process Above Green in Red
Elements.nFeedback4: Did you mean to serve ash? The roasting was way overdone!
